HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: What does HTML stand for?
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: Choose the correct HTML tag for the largest heading.
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: H1 is the tag for the largest heading, while H6 is the smallest heading.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: Which of the following property is used to create a small-caps effect?
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: The font-variant property is used to create a small-caps effect.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: CSS stands for?
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: Which is the correct CSS Syntax?
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: Element is followed by curly brackets. Inside curly brackets you select what you want to style followed by : and how you want to style. End with semi-colon.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: What is the script tag in this code snippet an example of?
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: Scripts can be placed in the <body>, or in the <head> section of an HTML page, or in both.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: Is this an example of a CSS comment: <!-- Write your comments here -->
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: This is an HTML comment

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: Bootstrap is a free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development.
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: It contains CSS- and JavaScript-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation, and other interface components.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: To add a caption to a table, you use the caption attribute in the opening table tag.
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: The <caption> tag must be inserted immediately after the <table> tag. Not inside the opening table tag

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: True-False: By default, relative-width frames are resizable.
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: If you do not want the frame windows to be resizeable, you should add the parameter {noresize} to the frame src lines

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: FIll in the Blank: Use _______ to make boxes pile horizontally across the page.
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: The float property is used for positioning and formatting content e.g. let an image float left to the text in a container.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: FIll in the Blank: An _______ rule can be used to define style rules for multiple media types in a single embedded style sheet.
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: The @media rule is used in media queries to apply different styles for different media types/devices.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: FIll in the Blank: A _______  tag defines a division or a section in an HTML document.
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: The <div> element is often used as a container for other HTML elements to style them with CSS or to perform certain tasks with JavaScript.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: FIll in the Blank: The _______ element contains meta information about the document
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: The <head> element is a container for metadata (data about data) and is placed between the <html> tag and the <body> tag.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: Where in an HTML document is the correct place to refer to an external style sheet?
options: A the end of the document
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: Each HTML page must include a reference to the external style sheet file inside the <link> element, inside the head section.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: What tag in HTML is used to enter a new line into the HTML contents. include the tage <>.
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: These tags are generally used to separate two different lines of text between each other.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: What tag is used to define a client-side script (JavaScript). Include the tage <>
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: The <script> element either contains script statements, or it points to an external script file through the src attribute.

HTML_CSS_QUIZ.question: What is the css code that will make an HTML element not display. Just write the one line with no spaces.
HTML_CSS_QUIZ.explanation: display: none; is commonly used with JavaScript to hide and show elements without deleting and recreating them.
